sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: February 15, 2017, 9:30 am Pacific Time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LETTER FROM OUR LEAD DIRECTOR AND  CHAIRMAN AND CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 4, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FELLOW STOCKHOLDERS,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Franklin Resources, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be  held on Wednesday, February 15, 2017 at 9:30 a.m. local time, at our offices in San Mateo, California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope that you will be able to attend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the past fiscal year, our Company has faced periods of market volatility and increasing regulation, significant  challenges for both management and the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has remained focused on the oversight of the  Companys strategy, devoting substantial time to our strategic priorities over the short and long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes tha although short term performance is important, it should be assessed in the context of the Companys long term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our management team has shown strong commitment and been proactive in the face of these pressures developing new products, preparing for upcoming regulatory changes and showing financial discipline and  expense management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also taken an active role in stockholder engagement this year, initiating a formal stockholder outreach program  under which we invited unaffiliated stockholders representing 25% of the Companys outstanding shares to meet and discuss  governance and executive compensation best practices as well as other issues of interest to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considers this  information when developing our policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We plan to continue our stockholder outreach program on an annual  basis going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Six new directors have joined our Board in the past five years, bringing with them diversity and fresh perspectives  and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors represent diverse viewpoints, with a wide array of experiences, professions, skills and  backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to a rigorous and comprehensive self-evaluation practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this effort, our  directors review the Board and Board Committee performance, as well as individual director performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we continued to maintain our focus on key governance practices that we believe are important to our  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These practices include: robust succession planning; 70% independent directors; no over-boarding; stock  ownership guidelines for directors and officers; annual majority voting for directors; no poison pill; and no super-majority  voting requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to maintaining a culture that promotes and values performance, integrity, ethics and a long-term view  aligned with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management compensation is performance driven.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addressing compensation decisions for fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee weighed our Company performance and the individual  performance of our management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, incentive compensation was modified to reflect corporate results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please read  the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of the Proxy Statement for specific information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We would like to thank each of you for your support of our Board and our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope that you find the Proxy  Statement informative and look forward to continuing our dialogue with you in the year to come.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to seeing you  at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GREGORY E. JOHNSON  Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PETER K. BARKER  Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEAR STOCKHOLDER:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Franklin Resources, Inc. (the Company) invites you to attend the 2017 annual meeting of  stockholders (the Annual Meeting) to be held on Wednesday, February 15, 2017 at 9:30 a.m., Pacific Time, in the  H. L. Jamieson Auditorium, at One Franklin Parkway, Building 920, San Mateo, California for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the 10 nominees for director named herein to the Board of Directors to hold office until the next annual meeting of stockholders or until that persons successor is elected and qualified or until his or her earlier death, resignation,  retirement, disqualification or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To hold an advisory vote to approve the compensation of the Companys named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To hold an advisory vote on how frequently stockholders believe we should obtain future advisory votes on the  compensation of the Companys named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To consider and vote on a stockholder proposal requesting a Board of Directors report on climate change and proxy voting practices, if properly presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To consider and vote on a stockholder proposal requesting a Board of Directors report on executive pay and proxy voting  practices, if properly presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. To transact such other business that may properly be raised at the Annual Meeting or any adjournments or  postponements of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are primarily furnishing proxy materials to our stockholders on the Internet rather than mailing paper copies of the  materials to each stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, some of you will receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials and  others will receive paper copies of the Proxy Statement and our Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy  Materials contains instructions on how to access the Proxy Statement and the Annual Report over the Internet, instructions  on how to vote your shares, as well as instructions on how to request a paper copy of our proxy materials, if you so  desire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electronic delivery is designed to expedite the receipt of materials, significantly lower costs and help to conserve  natural resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether you received the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or paper copies of our proxy materials, the  Proxy Statement, the proxy card, the Annual Report, and any amendments to the foregoing materials that are required to  be furnished to stockholders are available for you to review online at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors has fixed the close of business on December 19, 2016, as the record date for the  determination of stockholders entitled to receive notice of, and to vote on, all matters presented at the Annual Meeting or any adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is very important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you think that you will attend the Annual Meeting, we ask you to  please cast your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares via the Internet, by telephone, by mail or in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting will be limited to stockholders as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder will need to  provide an admission ticket or proof of ownership of the Companys stock and valid picture identification for admission to  the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admission procedures are described further on page 3 of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARIA GRAY Vice President
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 4, 2017 San Mateo, California

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders are furnished in connection with  the solicitation by the Board of Directors of Franklin Resources, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the Company), of the  accompanying proxy to be voted at the 2017 annual meeting of stockholders (the Annual Meeting), which will be held on  Wednesday, February 15, 2017, at 9:30 a.m., Pacific Time, in the H. L. Jamieson Auditorium, One Franklin Parkway, Building  920, San Mateo, California, 94403-1906, at the Companys principal executive offices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that this Proxy Statement  and the enclosed proxy will be mailed and/or made available to each stockholder entitled to vote on or about January 4, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: References to us, we or our as used throughout this Proxy Statement mean the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All materials filed by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) can be obtained at the SECs  Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, N.E., Washington, D.C. 20549 or through the SECs website at www.sec.gov.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may obtain information on the operation of the Public Reference Room by calling 1-800-SEC-0330.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE AVAILABILITY OF  PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the rules adopted by the SEC, we are furnishing proxy materials to our stockholders primarily over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  believe that this process should expedite stockholders receipt of proxy materials, lower the costs of our Annual Meeting  and help to conserve natural resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about January 4, 2017, we mailed to each of our stockholders (other than  those who previously requested electronic or paper delivery, participants in the Franklin Templeton 401(k) Retirement Plan  (the 401(k) Plan) and holders of shares in excess of certain thresholds), a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials  containing instructions on how to access and review the proxy materials, including this Proxy Statement and our Annual  Report, on the Internet and how to access a proxy card to vote on the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet  Availability of Proxy Materials also contains instructions on how to receive a paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received  a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials by mail, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials unless you request one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received paper copies of our proxy materials, you may also view these materials at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If  you received paper copies of our proxy materials and wish to receive them by electronic delivery in the future please request  electronic delivery on www.proxyvote.com or https://enroll.icsdelivery.com/ben/Default.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Board of Directors, we may decide that it is in the best  interests of our stockholders to hold a Say-on-Pay Vote more  or less frequently than the frequency period selected by  our stockholders.

sentences.text: WHO CAN VOTE?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of the Companys common stock, par value  $0.10 per share (the common stock), at the close of  business on December 19, 2016 (the Record Date) are  entitled to one vote for each share owned on that date  on each matter presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of  December 19, 2016, the Company had 566,559,183 shares  of common stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in  a stock brokerage account or by a bank or other holder of  record, you are considered the beneficial owner of shares  held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet Availability of  this Proxy Statement has been forwarded to you by your  broker, bank or other holder of record who is considered,  with respect to those shares, the stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As  the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your broker,  bank or other holder of record on how to vote your shares by  using the voting instruction form included in the mailing or  by following their instructions for voting by telephone or on  the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 5: Stockholder Proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal  requesting a Board report on climate change and proxy  voting practices, if properly presented at the Annual Meeting,  shall be voted on.

sentences.text: WHAT MATTERS ARE TO BE CONSIDERED AT THE  ANNUAL MEETING?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors does not know of any other matter to  be brought before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters  properly come before the meeting, the persons named in the  form of proxy or their substitutes will vote in accordance with  their best judgment on such matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, stockholders will be asked to consider  and vote upon the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1: Election of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal provides  for the election of 10 directors to the Companys Board to  hold office until the next annual meeting of stockholders  or until that persons successor is elected and qualified  or until his or her earlier death, resignation, retirement,  disqualification or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW MANY VOTES ARE NEEDED TO HOLD THE  ANNUAL MEETING?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to take any action at the Annual Meeting, a majority  of the Companys outstanding shares as of the Record Date  must be present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at  the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is called a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2: Advisory Vote to Approve Executive  Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal calls for a non-binding,  advisory vote regarding the compensation paid to our named  executive officers (the Say-on-Pay Vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly,  there is no required vote that would constitute approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Board of Directors, including our Compensation  Committee, values the opinions of our stockholders and will  consider the result of the vote when making future decisions  regarding our executive compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHO COUNTS THE VOTES?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The voting results will be tallied by Broadridge Financial  Solutions, Inc. and the Inspector of Elections, and reported  on a Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the SEC within  four business days following the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT IS A PROXY?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy allows someone else (the proxy holder) to vote  your shares on your behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is asking  you to allow any of the persons named on the proxy card  (Gregory E. Johnson, Chairman of the Board and Chief  Executive Officer; Rupert H. Johnson, Jr., Vice Chairman;  and Maria Gray, Vice President and Secretary) to vote your  shares at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3: Advisory Vote to Approve the Frequency of  Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal  provides a choice among three frequency periods (every  one, two or three years) for future advisory Say-on-Pay Votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency period that receives the most votes will be  deemed to be the recommendation of our stockholders.

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of shares of common  stock, having a majority of the votes present in person  or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and  entitled to vote on the matter, are necessary to ratify the  appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (Proposal  No. 4).

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a bank, broker or other  holder of record holding shares for a beneficial owner does  not vote on a particular proposal because the nominee  does not have authority to vote on that particular proposal  without receiving voting instructions from the beneficial  owner.

sentences.text: Under New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) rules,  the ratification of the selection of an independent registered  public accounting firm (Proposal No. 4), is considered a  routine matter, and brokers generally may vote on behalf of  beneficial owners who have not furnished voting instructions,  subject to the rules of the NYSE concerning transmission of  proxy materials to beneficial owners, and subject to any proxy  voting policies and procedures of those brokerage firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers may not vote on the other proposals contained in  this Proxy Statement, which are considered non-routine  proposals, unless they have received voting instructions from  the beneficial owner, and to the extent that they have not  received voting instructions, brokers report such number of  shares as non-votes.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company regularly monitors regulatory developments and reviews its policies and procedures in the area of  corporate governance to respond to such developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of those efforts, we review federal laws affecting  corporate governance, as well as corporate governance- related rules adopted by the SEC and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be considered independent, the Board  must determine affirmatively that the director does not have  material relationships with the Company either directly or as  a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has  a relationship with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such determination will be  made and disclosed pursuant to applicable NYSE or other  applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A material relationship can include, but is  not limited to, commercial, industrial, banking, consulting,  legal, accounting, charitable and family relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board has established the following guidelines to assist it  in determining whether a director does not have material  relationships and thereby qualifies as independent:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted  Corporate Governance Guidelines, which are posted in the  corporate governance section of the Companys website at  www.franklinresources.com (the Companys website).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Corporate Governance Guidelines set forth the practices  the Board follows with respect to, among other things, the  composition of the Board, director responsibilities, Board  committees, director access to officers, employees and  independent advisers, director compensation, director  orientation and continuing education, management  succession and performance evaluation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Multiple Board Memberships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board  has adopted, upon the recommendation of the Corporate  Governance Committee, a policy regarding memberships  on boards of directors or equivalent governance bodies of  unaffiliated publicly traded companies or other entities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a  member of the Board also serves as the principal executive  officer, such as the Chief Executive Officer or President,  of a publicly traded company, it is the policy of the Board  that such Board member shall not accept membership  on a board of directors or equivalent governance body of  another publicly traded company, without first informing  and obtaining the consent of the Companys Corporate  Governance Committee, if such new membership would  result in the member serving contemporaneously on three  or more boards of directors or equivalent governance bodies  of unaffiliated publicly traded companies, excluding the  Companys Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a member of the Board does not serve  as a principal executive officer, such as a Chief Executive  Officer or President, of a publicly traded company, it is  the policy of the Board that such Board member shall not  accept membership on a board of directors or equivalent  governance body of another publicly traded company,  without first informing and obtaining the consent of the  Companys Corporate Governance Committee, if such  new membership would result in the member serving  contemporaneously on four or more boards of directors or  equivalent governance bodies of publicly traded companies,  excluding the Companys Board.

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT THE BOARD AND ITS COMMITTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gregory E. Johnson, our Chief Executive Officer (CEO),  has served as Chairman of the Board since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the current structure is appropriate  because having a single leader for both the Company  and the Board provides clear leadership for the strategic  vision, management and operations of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board believes that this leadership structure strengthens  the Boards ability to focus on key risk, business and  strategic issues and helps the Company operate in the  long-term interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Peter K. Barker, an  independent director, has been selected by the independent  directors as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The duties of the Lead Director  are set forth in the Lead Director Charter available on the  Companys website at www.franklinresources.com/corp/ pages/generic_content/corporate_governance/lead_director_ charter.jsf and include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advising and consulting with the Chairman and CEO on,  and approving, Board and committee meeting schedules,  including the need for special meetings as appropriate,  and Board and committee meeting agenda items, to help  ensure that appropriate items are brought forward for  Board and committee consideration and appropriate time  is apportioned for discussion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advising and consulting with the Chairman and CEO on  the general scope and type of information to be provided  in advance and/or to be presented at Board meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in coordination with the Chairman and CEO, serving  as a liaison to stockholders who request direct  communications and consultation with the Board or  otherwise delegating such task to an appropriate member  of the Board based on the circumstances;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with outside counsel and other advisors as he  or she deems appropriate in fulfilling the Lead Director  role;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at the executive sessions of the independent  directors and of the non-employee directors of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: collaborating with the Compensation Committee on the  annual performance evaluation of the CEO; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at meetings of the Board in the absence of the  Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Board or upon the  request of the Chairman;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: collaborating with the Corporate Governance Committee  on matters related to Board effectiveness and  independence including the performance and structure  of the Board and its committees, and the performance of  individual directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling meetings of the independent directors and non- employee directors of the Board, as appropriate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as a liaison to facilitate communications between other members of the Board and the Chairman, the  Vice Chairman, the CEO and the Co-Presidents, without  inhibiting direct communications between and among  such persons;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board does not have a fixed policy regarding the  separation of the offices of the Chairman and Chief Executive  Officer, the Corporate Governance Committee reviews the  Boards leadership structure annually with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management and the Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Company recognizes the importance of effective risk  management to the success of our business and our  stockholders and has long-standing and highly developed  structures in place to manage risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors  has principal responsibility for oversight of the Companys  risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly receives  information on risks facing the Company from, and provides  oversight to, a variety of management groups, including the  enterprise risk management, global compliance, internal  audit, finance risk and control and compensation risk review  groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These groups provide reports either directly to the  full Board, or to the Audit Committee or Compensation  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these Board committees is comprised  solely of independent directors and reports to the full Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: at each Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regional and separate key risk  committees of our management, as well as business and  operational risk functions, report to the enterprise-wide  management groups which in turn report to the full Board  or a committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our internal audit and global  compliance groups conduct monitoring and testing of  Company-wide policies and procedures and report quarterly  to the Audit Committee and Board of Directors, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board oversees the Companys business continuity  planning, reviewing and approving managements plans with  respect to, among other things, key management succession,  disaster planning, crisis management, and prioritization  of recovery efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also reviews and approves
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement   |   17
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT THE BOARD AND ITS COMMITTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys Corporate Liquidity Policy, which addresses  how the Company would respond to possible liquidity crises  created by temporary market disruptions and/or longer-term  financial distress.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At their meetings, the Board, Audit Committee and  Compensation Committee review and discuss identified  risks with the relevant members of senior management  and members of the various groups with responsibility  for risk identification and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These regular  communications provide the Board with a practical and  in-depth understanding of the risks facing the Company  and enable the Board to provide direction to management  with respect to its approach to identifying, monitoring and  addressing material risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee receives risk management and internal  audit reports at least quarterly and oversees enterprise risk  assessment and risk management policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board receives reports of, and provides direction  to, the enterprise-wide risk management committee and  internal auditor at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee evaluates the Companys compensation policies  and programs to ensure they do not encourage excessive  risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A management compensation risk review  committee (the CRRC), which reviews new and existing  compensation programs and practices to ensure that they  do not encourage imprudent risk taking or expose the  Company to material amounts of risk, reports on its findings  to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the CRRCs  review of compensation arrangements across the Company,  the CRRC has undertaken a comprehensive assessment of  existing compensation programs and practices to ensure that imprudent risk-taking is not encouraged and that appropriate risk mitigation features are in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee  and the Compensation Committee report on risk, along with  other committee matters, at meetings of the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Boards role in risk oversight is well-supported by having  an experienced Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, who  has extensive knowledge of and experience with the risks that  the Company faces.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit, Compensation  and Corporate Governance Committees of the Board are  composed entirely of independent directors, as described  above in Committee Membership and Meetings, which the  Board believes also enhances risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and its subsidiaries allow non-employee  directors to defer payment of their directors fees and stock  awards in a manner that is intended to comply with the  provisions of Section 409A of the Code, and to treat the  deferred amounts as hypothetical investments in common  stock of the Company and/or in Company sponsored mutual  funds, as selected by the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are then credited with the same earnings, gains or losses that they would  have incurred if the deferred amounts had been invested  in the specific investments, in the specific amounts and for  the specific periods as directed by each particular director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, directors who defer their directors fees and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock awards are credited with notional dividends and other  distributions at the same time, in the same form, and in  equivalent amounts as dividends and other distributions that  are payable from time to time with respect to investments  selected by each particular director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the payout dates  elected by a director, the hypothetical investments are valued and the Company or its subsidiary, as applicable, must pay  the director or his or her beneficiary a cash amount equal to  the value of the hypothetical investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts may be  made in a lump sum or in periodic installments.

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) provides  an overview and analysis of the Compensation Committees  philosophy and objectives in designing compensation  programs for the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this CD&A,  we address the compensation determinations and the  rationale for those determinations relating to the Companys
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: chief executive officer, chief financial officer, and the next  three most highly compensated executive officers, whom  we refer to collectively as the named executive officers or  NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016, our  NEOs were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Title Gregory E. Johnson Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer Vijay C. Advani* Co-President Jennifer M. Johnson** Co-President Kenneth A. Lewis Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer Craig S. Tyle Executive Vice President and General Counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Effective as of December 31, 2016, Mr. Advani resigned as an officer of the Company and his employment with the Company terminated  on December 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3-year total shareholder return ranking was in the lowest  quartile of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee  evaluated the decline in 2016 performance consistent  with its philosophy that executive compensation should  reflect the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this, the  Committee reduced total compensation awarded for the  CEO by 21%, and total compensation awarded for all named  executive officers was reduced by an average of 10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total  compensation awarded means the total compensation  awarded to NEOs based on performance for fiscal year  2016 and not the amount reported in the Summary  Compensation Table herein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and other NEOs  also experienced forfeitures of certain previously granted  performance awards, as further described under the heading  Long-term Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that executive  compensation should be aligned with and support our  performance and business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee aims to focus the NEOs on our long-term  performance by using awards that generally vest over three  years as the Compensation Committee believes they are the  most effective tools for aligning the executives interests with  long-term stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of our NEOs  annual compensation linked to short-term performance  is intended to motivate and reward executives to achieve  certain objectives and to allow us to attract and retain  talented executives.

sentences.text: Our pay practices demonstrate our commitment to responsible compensation and governance practices.

sentences.text: At our 2014 Annual Meeting, our stockholders had the  opportunity to cast a non-binding advisory vote on the  compensation of our NEOs.

sentences.text: More than 98% of the shares  voted at the meeting approved the NEOs compensation.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee welcomed this feedback  and intends to continue its practice of linking executive  compensation with Company performance.

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AND SAY-ON-PAY VOTES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, we began our formal stockholder  engagement program to create the foundation for  sustained, long-term stockholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value our  stockholders interest and feedback, and we are committed  to maintaining an active dialogue to ensure that we  understand the priorities and concerns of our stockholders  with respect to best practices for governance matters and  executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent Lead Director,  Peter Barker, invited unaffiliated stockholders representing  25% of the Companys outstanding shares, to meet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  September and October of 2016, Mr. Barker conducted  telephonic meetings with stockholders representing  approximately 10% of the Companys outstanding  shares to discuss our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stockholders expressed support for our executive  compensation program, concurred with the Compensation  Committees use of discretion in determining bonus amounts due to the nature of our business, and did not suggest  making any changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, an advisory vote was taken on  the frequency with which we ask our stockholders to provide  an advisory vote on our executive compensation program  in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We proposed that the vote would be held  every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the shares that voted on this  proposal approved a three year period for say-on-pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3 gives our stockholders the opportunity to vote on  the frequency of obtaining an advisory vote on our executive  compensation program at our 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are  again proposing that the vote be held every three years.

sentences.text: In addition, in order to further align  the NEOs interests with our stockholders, each NEO is  expected to comply with our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  recent years, equity awards to our NEOs have been granted  in the form of restricted stock and restricted stock units  rather than options, in part, because the Compensation  Committee believes that in the current market restricted  stock is a better motivational tool than options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However,  the Compensation Committee may, in its discretion, award  stock options to executives in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term awards  vest over a three-year period based on the achievement of  predetermined Company financial performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the  event a performance measure is not achieved at or above a  specified threshold level, the portion of an award tied to such performance measure is forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Unit Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company-wide performance measures are driven by  and reflect the combined performance of our numerous  individual business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation  Committee recognizes that such Company-wide measures  may not fully reflect the individual performance and  contributions made by our separate business units and their  respective leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee therefore  believes that individual objectives should also be set for the  executives that are linked to the growth and development of  their respective business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such goals are specifically  tailored to each business unit and include, but are not  limited to, a mix of investment performance, sales, financial,  customer service, technology and human resources  objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee seeks to reward  executives who achieve such objectives as they are designed to improve business unit performance and contribute to the  performance of the Company as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of the NEOs annual compensation linked to  our short-term success is designed to motivate and reward  executives to achieve certain short-term objectives and to  attract and retain talented executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the  amount of annual awards, the Compensation Committee  does not use a rigid formula based on a single metric or a  combination of metrics as the Compensation Committee  believes that this would be inadequate to evaluate overall  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the  profitability of the firm as the starting point to establish  the maximum award pool under our Annual Incentive  Compensation Plan (AIP) for all plan recipients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards  to the NEOs are made pursuant to our 2014 Key Executive  Incentive Compensation Plan (KEIP), which is a sub-plan  of the AIP and awards thereunder are intended to qualify  for a tax deduction under Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Compensation Committee then establishes the maximum  portion of the KEIP pool that may be awarded to each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the actual amount awarded to each NEO,  the Compensation Committee uses discretion to adjust  the award downward and may use any one or more of the  Company-wide objectives and weightings for each NEO as  described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The award is made in cash and restricted  stock subject to time-based vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual objectives  for each NEO used for compensation determinations for the  2016 fiscal year are set forth under Individual Performance  Measures below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that executive  compensation should be linked with our performance and  significantly aligned with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  addition, executive compensation is designed to allow us to  recruit, retain and motivate employees who play a significant  role in our current and future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of the NEOs should be understood  within the context of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are an investment  management organization focused on long-term  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the Compensation Committees  main goals is to focus the executives on our long-term  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes  that long-term awards are effective tools for aligning the  executives interests with long-term stockholder interests  in order to increase overall stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,  the NEOs implement long-term initiatives for the Company  that, by definition, take more than one fiscal year to  accomplish.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stability and continuity among the NEOs aids  in our implementation of such long-term initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average  Company tenure for our NEOs as of September 30, 2016  was 23.8 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the use of a  strict formula based program for annual awards could have  inadvertent consequences such as encouraging the NEOs  to focus on the achievement of one specific metric to the  detriment of others metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, tying compensation  to a strict formula would not allow for adjustments based on  issues beyond the control of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee recognizes that each NEO other than the CEO  (each, a Senior Executive) may be most able to directly  influence the business unit for which he or she is responsible and therefore believes it is appropriate to use negative
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discretion to adjust annual awards for each such Senior  Executive to take into account the achievement of objectives  that are directly tied to the growth and development of  their respective business unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, with respect  to our overall executive compensation program, the use  of discretion provides the Compensation Committee with  the flexibility to compensate our NEOs for truly exceptional  performance without paying more than is necessary to incent  and retain them while maximizing available tax deductions  for performance-based compensation.

sentences.text: ROLE OF MANAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee works with members of  management, including our CEO, to seek input regarding  our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Twice a year the CEO,  aided by our corporate planning group, evaluates each  Senior Executive and his or her respective business units  progress in achieving its goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the CEO works  with senior members of our Human Resources Group to  recommend the appropriate award amount for each Senior  Executive based upon such performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this  process, the Human Resources Group conducts and reviews  an analysis of competitive compensation by peer companies  (listed below under Peer Group Companies), compares  previous year over year performance and compensation paid  to the executive, considers internal pay equity issues and  reviews third party executive compensation surveys related  generally to the financial services industry and specifically  to the asset management industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Human  Resources Group prepares tally sheets which include cash,  equity and other compensation paid to each Senior Executive  in prior periods as well as an analysis of the total projected  wealth accumulation for such executive over the next five  years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon completion of this review process, management  presents the performance evaluations to the Compensation  Committee and the CEO makes a recommendation regarding  the appropriate level of incentive compensation in relation to  the objectives achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee considers the  recommendation of our Human Resources Group as to  the appropriate size of the award pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In preparing its  recommendation, senior members of our Human Resources  Group meet periodically with our CEO to discuss competitive  compensation, retention, funding requirements and other  significant compensation issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the CEO meets  with the Chief Financial Officer (the CFO) to review the  quarterly financial performance of the Company over the  most recent quarters and the last two years, and in particular  focuses on the Companys year-over-year results with regard  to the Company-wide performance measures set forth  under the heading Company-wide Objectives above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  recommendation is reviewed and endorsed by the CEO prior  to its presentation to the Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: Tax Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating compensation program alternatives, the  Compensation Committee considers the potential impact  on the Company of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section  162(m) limits to $1 million the amount that a publicly  traded corporation, such as the Company, may deduct for  compensation paid in any year to its chief executive officer  and certain other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However,  compensation which qualifies as performance-based is  excluded from the $1 million per covered employee limit if,  among other requirements, the compensation is payable only upon attainment of pre-established, objective performance  goals under a plan approved by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Compensation  Committee, while considering tax deductibility as a factor in  determining compensation, may not limit compensation to  those levels or types of compensation that will be deductible  if it believes that the compensation is commensurate with the  performance of the covered employee.

sentences.text: We do not provide any executive officer, including any NEO,  with a gross-up or other reimbursement payment for  any tax liability that he or she might owe as a result of the  application of Sections 280G, 4999, or 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sections 280G and 4999 of the Code provide that executive  officers and directors who hold significant equity interests  and certain other service providers may be subject to an  excise tax if they receive payments or benefits in connection  with a change in control that exceeds certain prescribed  limits, and that the company, or a successor, may forfeit  a deduction on the amounts subject to this additional tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 409A also imposes additional significant taxes on  the individual in the event that an executive officer, director  or other service provider receives deferred compensation  that does not meet certain requirements of Section 409A of  the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee endeavors to maximize  deductibility of compensation under Section 162(m)  to the extent practicable while maintaining competitive  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee expects that  its performance-based awards either in the form of cash,  restricted stock or performance shares should qualify for  the performance-based compensation exception to Section  162(m).

sentences.text: Related Person Transaction Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors  has adopted a Related Person Transaction Policy (Related  Person Transaction Policy) to address the reporting, review,  approval and ratification of related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include the Companys executive officers,  directors and director nominees, holders of more than five  percent (5%) of a class of the Companys voting securities,  and immediate family members of the foregoing persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A  related person transaction means a transaction or series of  transactions in which the Company participates and a related  person has a direct or indirect interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples include  sales, purchases and transfers of real or personal property,  use of property and equipment by lease or otherwise,  services received or furnished and borrowings and lendings,  including guarantees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with executive officers  and directors for the purposes of conducting the business  of the Company, compensation of directors approved by the  Board and compensation arrangements approved by the  Compensation Committee are not considered related person  transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All related person transactions are required  to be reported to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Audit  Committee has the authority to determine categories of related person transactions that are immaterial and not required to  be disclosed and that need not be reported to, reviewed by,  and/or approved or ratified by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant  to the Related Person Transaction Policy, the following related  person transactions need not be reported to, reviewed by,  and/or approved or ratified by the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gross-ups and perquisites and other personal benefits  from the use of Company owned or provided assets,  including but not limited to personal use of Company- owned or provided aircraft and property, not used  primarily for Company business purposes that, in the  aggregate, are less than $10,000 in any fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Review and Approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every quarter the  Audit Committee reviews related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such  transactions involving an estimated amount of $120,000  or more require the approval or ratification of the Audit  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with approving or ratifying a related  person transaction, the Audit Committee will consider the  relevant facts and circumstances of the transaction and any  of the following factors that are relevant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The position or relationship of the related person at or  with the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The materiality of the transaction to the related person,  including the dollar value of the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business purpose for and reasonableness of the  transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The establishment or maintenance of a trading,  investment management, custody or other account with  an affiliate of the Company, if the terms of such account  are generally the same as or similar to accounts offered  by the affiliate of the Company in the ordinary course to  persons who are not related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the related person transaction is comparable to  a transaction that could be available on an arms-length  basis or is on the terms that the Company offers generally  to persons who are not related persons;

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2 ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE  EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 14A of the Securities Exchange  Act of 1934, which was added by the Dodd-Frank Wall  Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010 (the  Dodd-Frank Act) and the related SEC rules promulgated  thereunder, we are providing our stockholders the  opportunity to cast a non-binding advisory vote to approve  the compensation of the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  proposal, commonly known as a say-on-pay proposal, gives our stockholders the opportunity to express their views on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and utilizes components that align the interests of our  executives with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this approach  helps make our management team a key driver in our  financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, the Board recommends a vote in favor of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that the compensation paid to the Companys  named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item  402 of Regulation S-K, including the compensation tables and narrative discussion, is hereby APPROVED, on a  non-binding, advisory basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary objectives of our executive compensation  program are to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) offer balanced total compensation in an  effort to satisfy our stockholder, Company-wide, business  unit and individual executive goals,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) attract and retain high caliber executives and key personnel by offering competitive  compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) align the compensation of executives  with the goals of the Company by offering performance  incentives and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) provide that a significant portion of long- term compensation is at risk based on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  foregoing objectives are applicable to the compensation of  our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge our stockholders to  review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section  above and the compensation tables and narrative discussion  above for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding upon us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the advisory nature of this vote, the Board  values the opinions expressed by stockholders in their vote  on this proposal, and will consider the outcome of the vote  when making future compensation decisions for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the votes  cast by our stockholders in person or represented by proxy  and entitled to vote is required to approve this Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program, which  ties a significant portion of pay to performance, provides  competitive compensation to our named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR the approval of the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The voting  requirements for this proposal are described in the Voting Information section above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 52   |   Franklin Resources, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 3 ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF  EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ADVISORY VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by Section 14A of the Exchange Act and in  accordance with the Dodd-Frank Act, we are providing  our stockholders with the opportunity to vote, on a non- binding, advisory basis, on whether the Company will seek  an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs every  one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this proposal, you will  be able to specify how frequently stockholders would like us  to hold an advisory vote on the compensation of our named  executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation, including any changes in response to the  outcome of a prior advisory vote on executive compensation The holders of a majority of the Companys outstanding  shares agreed with our approach when the last advisory  vote was solicited and selected a frequency of once  every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the advisory proposal on the frequency of  holding future advisory votes on the compensation of our  named executive officers, you may vote for One Year, Two  Years or Three Years or mark your proxy Abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  will consider stockholders to have expressed a non-binding  preference for the frequency that receives the highest  number of favorable votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that an advisory vote on executive  compensation that occurs every three years is the most  appropriate alternative for the Company and therefore the  Board is again recommending that stockholders select a  frequency of once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considers  that an advisory vote at such frequency will provide our  stockholders with sufficient time to evaluate the effectiveness  of our overall compensation philosophy, objectives and  practices in the context of our long-term business results,  while avoiding over emphasis on short-term fluctuations  in compensation and business results that could occur  over shorter periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An advisory vote occurring once  every three years also permits our stockholders to fully  observe and evaluate the impact of any changes to our  executive compensation philosophy and objectives which  have occurred since the last advisory vote on executive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this proposal is advisory, the Board values the  opinion of our stockholders and will consider the voting  results when making decisions regarding the frequency of  future advisory votes on the compensation of our named  executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of one year, two  years or three years when you vote in response to this  proposal, and you may also abstain from voting on the  proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named in the accompanying proxy  card intend to vote proxies received by them in favor of  Three Years unless a different choice is specified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF THE BOARD The Board of Directors recommends a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys responsibilities to its stockholders differ from the responsibilities of the Companys investment  adviser subsidiaries (the FTI Advisers) to the clients on whose behalf they hold securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company must act  in what it believes to be the best interests of the corporation and its stockholders, including appropriately addressing  climate change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is proud of its record of taking steps to reduce the Companys environmental impact,  including recycling and reuse of natural resources, seeking to minimize energy consumption and mitigating greenhouse  gas emissions associated with the Companys operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, the FTI Advisers, and not the Company, are  responsible for voting proxies on behalf of their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting proxies, the FTI Advisers must act solely in the best  interest of their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FTI Advisers consider climate change and other ESG-related issues when voting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FTI Advisers proxy  voting policies provide that votes cast on ESG issues will be at the discretion of a funds individual portfolio managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FTI Advisers and their portfolio managers will generally vote in favor of ESG proposals that they believe have significant  economic benefits for their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Company, nor the FTI Advisers, have ever stated that the FTI Advisers  would vote for any particular climate change proposal or percentage of such proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent an FTI Adviser  votes against an ESG-related proposal, it is because the portfolio managers within the FTI Adviser determined that such  proposal would not have significant economic benefits for their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This reflects the fiduciary obligations of the FTI  Advisers to their clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A report on the Companys proxy voting record related to climate change would not benefit the Company or its  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the concerns stated in the stockholder proposal are already addressed by the FTI Advisers  current proxy voting policies and we do not believe that a report on the proxy voting record of the FTI Advisers on climate  change-related proposals would provide any additional benefit to the Company or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholder  proposal would involve the Company and its Board of Directors to a much greater extent in these proxy votes and  potentially subject investment personnel at the FTI Advisers to inappropriate influence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also concerned that the  stockholder proposal, if implemented, would elevate the social objectives of an owner of the Companys shares over the  FTI Advisers fiduciary duty to vote proxies solely in their clients best interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder of the Company has advised us that it will ask  you to vote on a proposal at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a comparison of Franklin Templetons 2015 votes on pay  to those of six large pension funds, a number of instances  were identified in which the majority of those public funds  voted against the pay packages, while Franklin Templeton  Investments voted in favor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stephen M. Silberstein Revocable Trust has submitted  the following proposal (the address and number of shares of  the Companys common stock held by this stockholder will  be provided upon request):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some cases, Franklin Templeton affiliated managers voted  differently on the same advisory pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, five of  the six public funds voted against the advisory vote on pay at  Caterpillar; of the nine Franklin Templeton Funds which held  the stock, five voted in favor and four opposed the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investors who own share in a Franklin Templeton affiliated  fund can find out how funds voted, but do not have a way to  understand the discrepancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whereas: Franklin Templeton Investments, like all investment managers, is responsible for voting proxies of companies in  its portfolios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has a fiduciary responsibility to vote proxies  in a responsible manner in the interests of its clients, which  includes ensuring that executive pay is not excessive and,  if it deviates from the average, is strictly and sufficiently tied  to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Numerous academic studies, for example Lucien Bebchucks  Pay Without Performance, indicate a history of growing  executive pay disconnected from company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even when companies purport to link performance, in reality  they often do not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benjamin Franklin embodies thrift, and is known for the  saying, A penny saved is a penny earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current  system of executive pay generally does not follow this  principle; indeed, it embodies waste and greed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Franklin  Templeton Investments votes in favor of most excessive  executive compensation packages (see As You Sows The  100 Most Overpaid CEOs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: Shareowners request the Board of Directors  issue a report by December 2018, at reasonable cost and  omitting proprietary information, which evaluates options for  bringing its voting practices in line with its stated principle of  linking executive compensation and performance, including  adopting changes to proxy voting guidelines, adopting best  practices of other asset managers and independent rating  agencies, and including a broader range of research sources  and principles for interpreting compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such  report should assess whether and how the proposed changes  would advance the interests of its clients and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We find Franklin Templeton Investments voting record  inconsistent with its guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Franklin Templetons  affiliated investment managers votes separately, under  guidelines that note: The Investment Manager evaluates  plans on a case-by-case basis by considering several factors  to determine whether the plan is fair and reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting proxies, the FTI Advisers must act solely in the best interest of their clients.

sentences.text: This voting policy is consistent  with the fiduciary obligations of the FTI Advisers to their clients.

sentences.text: We believe that the concerns stated in the stockholder proposal are already addressed by the FTI  Advisers current proxy voting policies and we do not believe that a report on the proxy voting record of the FTI Advisers  on proposals related to executive compensation would provide any additional benefit to the Company or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholder proposal would involve the Company and its Board of Directors to a much greater extent in these proxy  votes and potentially subject investment personnel at the FTI Advisers to inappropriate influence.
